title: New York Fed Staffer Warns of Possible Downward Pressure on Money Market Rates
sub_head: The Federal Reserve has the ability to keep borrowing costs in line, the staffer adds
body:
Short-term market-set interest rates may come under downward pressure over coming months due to a mix of technical forces, but the Federal Reserve has the ability to keep those borrowing costs where it wants them to be, a top Federal Reserve Bank of New York official said Tuesday.
Money market rates may start to ease as Treasury deposits at the Fed decrease along with changes in the U.S. governmentâ€™s short-term borrowing activities amid shifts in how banks manage reserve levels, Lorie Logan, a New York Fed executive vice...
